info.title: Parcel.One Shipping REST API
info.description:
ParcelOne [https://parcel.one](https://parcel.one) provides you with a REST API for implementing an interface to ParcelOne shipping services into your own shop/warehouse or, respectively, into the shops/warehouses of your customers.
 ___
 This documentation was created adhering to the OpenAPI 3.0 standard. We use Swagger.IO tool for display. If you prefer to use another OpenAPI-Tool or want to implement this into your own environment, you may download the underlying OpenAPI-Document from here:
 * [JSON-Format](https://doc.parcelone.io/ParcelOneShippingRESTApiV1.json)
 * [YAML-Format](https://doc.parcelone.io/ParcelOneShippingRESTApiV1.yaml)
 ___
## Basic Implementation Principles
###  Sandbox and Production-Modes
In order to be able to test your implementation without interfering production environment, we provide a SandBox-Mode as well as a Production-Mode. The URLs:
* Sandbox: https://sandbox.parcelone.io/shippingapi/v1
* Production: https://production.parcelone.io/shippingapi/v1

Please, use the Sandbox mode to test your client application thoroughly before switching to Production mode. In Sandbox mode all data will be saved to a separate database.

###  Dynamic Approach
Differenty from other carriers, Parcel.one provides a products and services structure that may vary for different customers. Therefore, we strongly recommend not to use hardcoded products and services identifiers, but to use a dynamic approach using the profile-functions to get the products and services hierarchy and show it dynamically in your client UI! Also there may be several mandators and for each mandator several consigner/sender-addresses. Every mandator can have a different portfolio of products/services. So, please, strongly consider a dynamic approach!

To get acquainted with the dynamic mandator, consigner, Carriers and Products/Services setup, please, start with the customer- and profile-path-functions.

 ___
## Verification and Validation process
After we took a careful look to your shipments in our sandbox environment to validate your integration, you will be provided with access to our production environment.
For the validation of your implementation, we will look for the following items, which you should consider carefully while developing your software:
>    Provision of an own string in the data field 'Software' (including a version number) to make your implementation identifiable

>    Creation of shipping labels
> >      to various recipients
> >        including a phone and/or mobile phone number of the recipient
> >        including an eMail address of the recipient
> >      with different recipient addresses
> >      in different destination countries
> >      EU and non-EU shipments
> >       using various PARCEL.ONE products
> >       with various combinations of optional services, that can be applied
> >       with different weights for shipments
> >       providing the dimensions of the shipment, even if you intend to skip providing them or to provide default values in production use
> >       providing full customs information for all shipments to non EU countries, even if you currently do not intend to ship to such countries
>    Cancellation of shipping labels

We are listing these points in such detail as we want to see in advance, that your implementation is capable to provide all parameters for creating shipments and that you have understood our API and the products PARCEL.ONE provides. This will save both of us a lot of trouble in the future, when production mode is going on.
Please contact us as soon as you have completed your creation of your test shipments that we may start immediately with our evaluation.
___
## Authentification
Authentification is provided by Basic Authentification secured over SSL.
Further authentification is done via an API-Key to authenificate the provider of the software accessing the API. If you are a platform provider for Parcel.One clients, please, keep in mind, that the ApiKey is only as an identification for you and should not be provided to or even be edited in the UI by the users of your platform.

You may also make use of a JWT Access Token to speed up authentification on subsequent requests: Just specify a Header named 'Getaccesstoken' with any value, e.g. value of 'true' along with any of your requests. This will return the JWT access token being valid for the next 12 hours. Your subsequent requests may now be authentificated with this bearer JWT token instead of using Basic Authentification and the ApiKey.

Please, contact us if you would like to receive an API-Key and Sandbox Login data for your development. For a simple test of valid Authentification data we recommend using the 'datetime' or 'customer' path functions.
___

get.summary: get closable shipments as csv, separated by Ceps
get.description:
get closable shipments as csv files, one for each Cep/Carrier
Closing is not necessary for availability for Shipping. It solely marks shipments as closed and returns a report for your use. For DHL it does NOT perform the actual DHL closing, this will be done automatically by DHL Background Services once a day.)
This path-function CLOSABLE provides a list of shipments that are available for your closing. Results can be filtered by several parameters. Only shipments created by the same API-Key are considered to avoid conflicts.

parameters.name: mandator
parameters.description: Mandator - maybe '*' for all or specific mandator

parameters.name: consigner
parameters.description: Consigner or Sender - maybe '*' for all or specific consigner of specified mandator

parameters.name: cep
parameters.description: Cep or Carrier - maybe '*' for all or specific

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: StartDate in format 'YYYYMMDD' - maybe '*' for all or specific date

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: EndDate in format 'YYYYMMDD' - maybe '*' for all or specific date

get.summary: get ClosedStamps as Array of Strings
get.description:
get ClosedStamps as Array of Strings
Closing is not necessary for availability for Shipping. It solely marks shipments as closed and returns a report for your use. For DHL it does NOT perform the actual DHL closing, this will be done automatically by DHL Background Services once a day.)
This path-function STAMPS provides a list of closing stamps for shipments that have been closed already, filtered by several parameters. Only shipments created by the same API-Key are considered to avoid conflicts.

parameters.name: mandator
parameters.description: Mandator - maybe '*' for all or specific mandator

parameters.name: consigner
parameters.description: Consigner or Sender - maybe '*' for all or specific consigner of specified mandator

parameters.name: cep
parameters.description: Cep or Carrier - maybe '*' for all or specific

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: StartDate in format 'YYYYMMDD' - maybe '*' for all or specific date

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: EndDate in format 'YYYYMMDD' - maybe '*' for all or specific date

get.description:
reprint Closing List as a CSV file or as a PDF document
Closing is not necessary for availability for Shipping. It solely marks shipments as closed and returns a report for your use. For DHL it does NOT perform the actual DHL closing, this will be done automatically by DHL Background Services once a day.)
This path-function REPRINT reprints a closing list by specifying the ClosedStamp as a parameter. Output may be CSV or PDF. Only shipments created by the same API-Key are considered to avoid conflicts.

parameters.name: closedStamp
parameters.description: ClosedStamp to reprint

parameters.name: FormatType
parameters.description: OutputType for ClosingList - CSV file or PDF document

errors.Message: This ClosedStamp could not be found.
Missing parameter: ClosedStamp

post.description:
Closing Shipments as filtered by given parameters, returns ClosingLists as CSV or PDF, one for each CEP/Carrier concerned.
Closing is not necessary for availability for Shipping. It solely marks shipments as closed and returns a report for your use. For DHL it does NOT perform the actual DHL closing, this will be done automatically by DHL Background Services once a day.)
This is the main function to perform the actual closing. You can filter shipments to close by several parameters. Only shipments created by the same API-Key are considered to avoid conflicts.

get.summary: get Customer status for default Mandator and its Consigners data
get.description:
Get Customer status and default Mandator and Consigners data
Also provides information about status of a customer - active, blocked or annulled - and which entities are considered default. Reflects system configuration for customer.

get.summary: reprint Customs Documents by Shipment Identification
get.description:
Reprint Customs Documents by Shipment Identification.
Availabe formats are CN22 or CN23 (two documents per page). The CN22-document may contain up to 7 customs detail lines, the CN23-document will print up to 17 detail lines. If more than 7 detail lines, CN23 will be printed automatically.

parameters.name: FormatSize
parameters.description: Desired Size of returned Document - CN23 or CN22

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.

get.summary: reprint Customs Documents by Shipment and Package Identification
get.description:
Reprint Customs Documents by Shipment and Package Identification.
Availabe formats are CN22 or CN23 (two documents per page). The CN22-document may contain up to 7 customs detail lines, the CN23-document will print up to 17 detail lines. If more than 7 detail lines, CN23 will be printed automatically.

parameters.name: FormatSize
parameters.description: Desired Size of returned Document - CN23 or CN22

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.

post.description:
Register Customs Data for a Shipment that has been already created.
Customs information may be either registered immediately when registering a shipment, or registered afterwards for a created shipment with this path-function. A CN22 or CN23-document (two documents per page) will be returned. The CN22-document may contain up to 7 customs detail lines, the CN23-document will print up to 17 detail lines. If more than 7 detail lines, CN23 will be printed automatically.
For customs detail lines, you can either provide netweight and itemvalue as a sum for the specified item quantity or specify netweightperitem and itemvalueperitem for a quantity of 1. In this case - but only if netweight and itemvalue fields are null or 0 - the netweight and itemvalue will be multiplied by provided quantity automatically.

requestBody.description: Provide International Customs Data for a specific already existing Shipment/Package

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.
The following fields exceed the allowed maximal fieldlength or value:...

get.description: This path-function returns Server-DateTime in CET- and UTC-Format. It is well suited to test your authorization setup on proper functioning.

get.summary: get mandators status and availabe Mandators and Consigners data
get.description:
Get mandator status and availabe Mandators and Consigners data
Also provides information about status of a mandator - active, blocked or annulled - and which entities are considered default. Reflects system configuration for mandator.

get all mandators, consigners, CEPS, Products and Services for customer
The profile path-functions help you to realize a dynamic approach of the mandator, consigners, CEPS, Products and Services hierarchy in your UI. Profiles of available products can be returned for a specified list of countries, e.g. if you are working with shipping zones. A level parameter can limit the response to a specified depth of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: level (int) - depth of hierarchy returned (0=all)

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: countries (string) - optional, products are checked against availability in all countries specified. Just write all 2-char-Country-Abbreviations into one string like e.g. 'ATDE' for counties AT and DE.

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: weight (int) - optional, package weight in grams

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: length (int) - optional, package length in millimeters

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: width (int) - optional, package width in millimeters

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height (int) - optional, package height in millimeters

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: address (bool) - optional, return mandator and consigners addresses

parameters.name: maxvalues
parameters.description: maxvalues (bool) - optional, return maximum weight and dimensions for products, valid only for Parcel.One

get.description:
get all CEPs for a mandator specified.
The profile path-functions help you to realize a dynamic approach of the mandator, consigners, CEPS, Products and Services hierarchy in your UI. Profiles of available products can be returned for a specified list of countries, e.g. if you are working with shipping zones. A level parameter can limit the response to a specified depth of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: countries

parameters.name: length

parameters.name: height

parameters.name: maxvalues

get Products and corresponding services for a mandator and cep specified.
The profile path-functions help you to realize a dynamic approach of the mandator, consigners, CEPS, Products and Services hierarchy in your UI. Profiles of available products can be returned for a specified list of countries, e.g. if you are working with shipping zones. A level parameter can limit the response to a specified depth of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: weight

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: length (int) - optional, package length in millimeters

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: width (int) - optional, package width in millimeters

parameters.name: height

parameters.name: maxvalues

get.summary: get Services for a mandator and cep and product specified
get.description:
get Services for a mandator and cep and product specified.
The profile path-functions help you to realize a dynamic approach of the mandator, consigners, CEPS, Products and Services hierarchy in your UI. Profiles of available products can be returned for a specified list of countries, e.g. if you are working with shipping zones.

parameters.name: cep
parameters.description: ID of CEP to return

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: ID of Product to return

parameters.description: countries (string) - optional, products are checked against availability in all countries specified. Just write all 2-char-Country-Abbreviations into one string like e.g. 'ATDE' for counties AT and DE.

parameters.description: weight (int) - optional, package weight in grams

parameters.name: length

get.description:
Get Shipment Status and Last Mile Carrier Info
This path-function may help to follow up on the last-mile-carrier info for Parcel.One shipments. It will make most sense to invoke it once a day in the evening after daily closings by Parcel.One has taken place.

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.

delete.description:
cancel Shipment
There will be returned an error message, if the shipment has already been proceeded and cancelling is not possible anymore.

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.
Carrier ... is not supported.
There was a problem when saving information to database.

results.Document: JVBERi0x... - your label Document as Base64-String...

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.

get.description: reprint Shipment Documents - for Parcel.One there should be only one ReturnLabel-Document returned if the corresponding products or services were transmitted. Customs documents for Parcel.One will be retuned by the customs/reprint function. For UPS and DHL there may be more than one document returned. Print Shipment Documents, including DHL ExportDocuments. The customs reprint path-function will return the CN23 also for DHL, if preferred.

results.Document: JVBERi0x... - your Returnlabel Document as Base64-String...

errors.Message: This Shipment could not be uniquely identified.

post.description:
Register Shipment.
This Post-Function allows to provide shipment address information, the desired product and services information, customs information if needed as well as requesting Return labels as single Return labels or along with the shipment label for some countries. The response may contain the shipment information, shipment label, requested Return labels as well as customs documents. You may provide flags to control which documents to return and which only to create and request later by other functions. All documents returned are Base64-encoded.
The provided examples mainly concentrate on how to register Parcel.One shipments. If there are configured UPS and DHL shipments for you also and you feel you need more information about how to integrate those, please, feel free to contact our support for more information on this. For Parcel.One and DHL there may be specified only one package, for UPS despending on the selected product there may be several packages possible for one shipment.
For customs detail lines, if you have to provide them, you can either provide netweight and itemvalue as a sum for the specified item quantity or specify netweightperitem and itemvalueperitem for a quantity of 1. In this case - but only if netweight and itemvalue fields are null or 0 - the netweight and itemvalue will be multiplied by provided quantity automatically.

Request - Parcel.One EU Shipment with Re.summary: Request - Parcel.One EU Shipment with ReturnLabel in DocumentResults

Request - Parcel.One non-EU shipment wit.summary: Request - Parcel.One non-EU shipment with Customs data

ResultSuccess - Parcel.One EU Shipment w.summary: ResultSuccess - Parcel.One EU Shipment with ReturnLabel in DocumentResults

ResultSuccess - Parcel.One non-EU shipme.summary: ResultSuccess - Parcel.One non-EU shipment with Customs data

PackageResults.Label: JVBER...your Label  Document as Base64-encoded string ...

InternationalDocumentsResults.Document: JVBER...your Customs Document as Base64-encoded string ...

AddInfo.description: for Customs and CustomsDetails so far: Key: free definable additional Info, Value: free definalbe additional values for customs handling

Default.description: - if default CEP for this Mandator - bool

Products.description: - List of Products for this CEP

CEPSpecial.description: for DHL so far: Key: PRINTONLYIFCODEABLE, Value: 1 - will return label only in case LEITCODE could be found to avoid Surcharge for not codable addresses

Default.description: - if default Consigner for this Mandator - bool

Customer.description: Customer information including Mandators and Consigners

Default.description: - if Default for this Customer - bool

Consigners.description: - List of Consigners for this Mandator

Measurement.description: - so far only CM for centimeter

Type.description: - MaxLen 10 - for printing in most cases: GIF,PDF, ZPL203, ZPL300

Size.description: - no Maxlimit - for printing of Customs documents: CN22, CN23, in other cases so far no effects on fixed return formats

IntDoc.description: InternationalDocumentFormat:Type PDF,GIF,ZPL203 or ZPL300, Size CN22,CN23

IntDocContents.description: Customs Details - if you only specify ItemValuePerItem and NetWeightPerItem, NetWeight and ItemValue will be multiplied by Quantity automatically.

Contents.example: Item of Contents of the Package

Default.description: if Default Product for CEP - bool

Profile.description: Profile - contains whole mandator,consigners,ceps,products and services hierarchy for a customer or set filters

Consigners.description: - List of Consigners for this Mandator

CEPs.description: - List of CEPs for this Mandator

example.Message: Wrong ApiKey for access to WebService.

UniqId.description: - Unique Request Id for Log Reference

ResultSuccess.description: Success Result basic structure - extended by individual Results

UniqId.description: - Unique Request Id for Log Reference

AmountNeeded.description: - if Amount is required for this Service (e.g. for COD-Service)- bool

CurrencyNeeded.description: - if Currency is required for this Service (e.g. for COD-Service)- bool

ShipFrom.description: Consigner / Sender address - only needed if there is a special agreement with Parcel.One, mostly replaced by ConsignerID

SalesTaxID.description: - MaxLen 20 - Sales TaxID of Consigner,not in use yet.

BranchID.description: - MaxLen 20 - Branch or Pickup ID of Carrier. If PUDO-Shipping, then PUDO-Number must be provided here.

CEPCustID.description: - MaxLen 20 - Carrier Customer ID of Receiver, e.g. UPS Customer No. for cheaper Shipping. Not in use yet.

Shipment.description: Shipment array for registering of shipments

ShipmentID.description: - MaxLen 20 - your ShipmentID for evaluating the response, where it will be returned as YourShipmentID, will not be available anymore after the shipment creation process

ShipmentRef.description: - MaxLen 50 - this will be always available as a reference for further actions in case you keep it unique

ReturnShipmentIndicator.description: - 0 = Forward Shipment, all values bigger 0 = Return Shipment. For UPS the following are available: 2-Print and Mail Return Label by UPS; 3-Return Service 1-Attempt; 5-Return Service 3-Attempt; 8-Electronic Return Label by URL; 9-Print Return Label.

ReturnCharges.description: - Get Charges back if available  for future use - bool

CEPSpecials.description: - CEP Specials Info - for DHL so far: Key: PRINTONLYIFCODEABLE, Value: 1 - will return label only in case LEITCODE could be found to avoid Surcharge for not codable addresses.

ShipmentActionResult.description: Additional ActionResult for detailed information about shipments or errors

PackageID.description: - MaxLen 20 - sequential package count will be returned in response, for Parcel.One will always be 1

PackageRef.description: - MaxLen 20 - Reference of package to be accessible lateron, exception Parcel.One with reserving LastMileCarrierTracknumber at shipping - in this case PackageRef will return the last mile carrier and PackageTrackingID returns the LMC Trackingnumber.

PackageTrackingID.description: - MaxLen 20 - Package Tracking Number, exception Parcel.One with reserving LastMileCarrierTracknumber at shipping - in this case PackageRef will return the last mile carrier and PackageTrackingID returns the LMC Trackingnumber.

PackageID.description: - MaxLen 20 - sequential package count will be returned in response, for Parcel.One will always be 1

PackageRef.description: - MaxLen 20 - package reference from request, exception Parcel.One with reserving LastMileCarrierTracknumber at shipping - in this case PackageRef will return the last mile carrier and PackageTrackingID returns the LMC Trackingnumber.

TrackingID.description: - MaxLen 20 - Package Tracking Number, exception Parcel.One with reserving LastMileCarrierTracknumber at shipping - in this case PackageRef will return the last mile carrier and PackageTrackingID returns the LMC Trackingnumber.

YourShipmentID.description: - MaxLen 20 - your ShipmentID from Request, last time available here for your reference of shipment creation

InternationalDocumentsAvailable.description: - If international document is available - bool

InternationalDocumentsNeeded.description: - If international documents are needed - bool

Shipper.description: Consigner / Sender address - only needed if there is a special agreement with Parcel.One, mostly replaced by ConsignerID

SalesTaxID.description: - MaxLen 20 - Sales TaxID of Consigner,not in use yet.

Getaccesstoken.name: Getaccesstoken
Getaccesstoken.description: Header-flag to return JWT Access Token, insert 'true' to send this header

tags.name: Migration from WCF
tags.description: If you are migrating from our previos WCF-API to the actual REST-API, you will find useful information about which WCF-function corresponds to which REST-API-Path e.g. in our specific external documentation!

tags.name: Multilinguality
tags.description: To make use of our multilingual support, please, specify a Header named 'Lang' with a value of one of our supported languages in ISO-3166-2-format: 'de' for German, 'en' for English or 'es' for Spanish.

tags.name: Errors
tags.description: You may find a list of current Error-Messages used here. Every request is assigned a unique RequestID, therefore, if you like to report some misbehavior of the API, please, provide us with the UniqId returned in every response. This way we can refer to our logfiles easier. Thank you!
